<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Thanadaemon (Death Daemon)](/Monsters.aspx?ID=595)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Also known as the deacons of death, thanadaemons represent death via old age. They are among the most patient daemons, and prefer to bide their time to enact far-reaching, decades-long plans rather than fight (though they are still deadly foes). Like the Horseman of Death, they ply the waters of the River Styx in search of wayward souls. Rarely are thanadaemons seen without a trademark oar (which they wield as a [bo staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=17)), a tool they use to navigate the river's muck-ridden channels and turbulent rapids.

<column gap="tiny">

([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 31

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Daemon_Thanadaemon.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 13">[Thanadaemon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=595)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Daemon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=213" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=70" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 60 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Daemonic](/Languages.aspx?ID=31); [telepathy 100 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37)

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +22, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +26, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +26, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +22, [Styx Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +24

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +6

**Con** +4

**Int** +3

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +7
</row>

**Items**
_+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [bo staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=17)_, soul gem (2)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 34 

**Fort** +21 

**Ref** +23 

**Will** +26 

+1 status to all saves vs. magic
</row>

**HP** 270

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects

**Weaknesses**
good 10

**Terrifying Gaze** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 30 Will save. If the creature fails, it becomes [frightened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19). The creature is then temporarily immune to terrifying gaze (but not Focus Gaze) for 24 hours.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet; [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
bo staff +28 ([Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Parry](/Traits.aspx?ID=190), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 3d8+14 bludgeoning plus 1d6 negative, 1d6 evil, and draining strike

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 3d6+14 slashing plus 1d6 evil and draining strike

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 34
- **1st**
[Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (good only; at will)
- **4th**
[Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will)
- **5th**
[Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69)
- **6th**
[Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289), [Vampiric Exsanguination](/Spells.aspx?ID=353) (×2)
- **7th**
[Finger of Death](/Spells.aspx?ID=116), [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222) (at will; self plus skiff and passengers only; [Astral](/Planes.aspx?ID=8), [Ethereal](/Planes.aspx?ID=9), and evil planes only), [Teleport](/Spells.aspx?ID=338)
- **Constant (7th)**
[Air Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Rituals** DC 34

- **2nd**
[Create Undead](/Rituals.aspx?ID=10)

**Draining Strike**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) When a thanadaemon damages a living creature with a melee Strike, the creature must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or become [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10). Further damage dealt by the thanadaemon increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

**Focus Gaze** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) The thanadaemon glares at a single creature they can see within 30 feet. If the target wasn't already [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19), they must immediately attempt a DC 33 Will save against the thanadaemon's terrifying gaze. If the target was already frightened, they must attempt a DC 33 Will save or become [fleeing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=17) for 1d4 rounds; this second effect has the [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93) trait. After attempting its save, the creature is temporarily immune to this ability until the start of the thanadaemon's next turn.

**Soul Crush** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirements** The thanadaemon has a soul gem; **Effect** The thanadaemon crushes the soul gem in one hand and gains [fast healing 15](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) for 1 minute.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Styx Passage Fees</title>

Gliding with eerie ease along the murky River Styx, thanadaemons are only too happy to offer mortals passage aboard their dilapidated skiffs—for a price. Gold is typically an acceptable payment for a thanadaemon's services, though these fiends are well-known for altering the details of arrangements after the fact, and may just as likely demand a favor or some esoteric good, such as a soul gem, instead of coin.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-26" />
